hints: This is the QuartzBio Python client library and CLI - a genomic data platform REST API client using mixin-based architecture.
When modifying code, add a comment: 'Code updates performed by AI'.

Architecture: Mixin-based resources compose functionality via multiple inheritance (CreateableAPIResource, ListableAPIResource, DeletableAPIResource, UpdateableAPIResource, DownloadableAPIResource, SearchableAPIResource, SingletonAPIResource).
Resources declare capabilities through mixins: CreateableAPIResource adds create(), ListableAPIResource adds all(), DeletableAPIResource adds delete(), UpdateableAPIResource adds save().
Base classes: QuartzBioObject (inherits dict, tracks changes via _unsaved_values) -> APIResource (URL generation, refresh()) -> Resource mixins.
Change tracking: _unsaved_values set tracks modifications. When obj.field='value', field is added to _unsaved_values. obj.save() PATCHes only changed fields.
Type registry: resource/__init__.py types dict maps class_name to classes. API responses with class_name automatically convert to correct resource type (Dataset, Vault, etc).
URL construction: class_url()=/v{RESOURCE_VERSION}/{pluralized_snake_case}, instance_url()=class_url/{id}. Conversion in resource/util.py (camelcase_to_underscore, class_to_api_name).
Lazy evaluation: Resources and queries don't fetch until accessed. Query objects only make API calls during iteration or execute().
Query DSL: Filter objects build WHERE clauses (f = Filter(gene='BRCA1') & Filter(start__gt=1000)). Supports __in, __range, __gt, __gte, __lt, __lte, ~ (NOT), & (AND), | (OR).
GenomicFilter: Specialized for ranges via from_string('chr1:100-200') or GenomicFilter('chr1', 100, 200, exact=False). Generates genomic_coordinates filters.
Query chaining: dataset.query(Filter(...)).filter(...).limit(1000). Automatic pagination during iteration. Use q.count() without fetching all, len(q) respects limit, q[100:200] for slicing.
CLI pattern: Custom ArgumentParser with subcommands dict in cli/main.py. Each subcommand has func, help, arguments. Custom actions: TildeFixStoreAction, KeyValueDictAppendAction.
Authentication priority: 1) Function parameters, 2) QUARTZBIO_ACCESS_TOKEN/EDP_ACCESS_TOKEN/SOLVEBIO_ACCESS_TOKEN env vars, 3) ~/.quartzbio/credentials (netrc format).
Credential storage: cli/credentials.py manages ~/.quartzbio/credentials in netrc format. quartzbio login saves, quartzbio logout deletes.
Testing: Integration tests require live API credentials. Set QUARTZBIO_API_HOST and QUARTZBIO_ACCESS_TOKEN env vars. Tests extend QuartzBioTestCase in test/helper.py.
Test commands: 'python setup.py test', 'make check', 'make test-<module>' (e.g., make test-sample runs quartzbio.test.test_sample), 'tox' for multi-version.
Flake8: Max line length 120. Ignored: E127, E203, E402, N801, N802, E722, W504, W503. Run with 'flake8 quartzbio' or 'make lint'.
New resources: Add class in resource/, extend appropriate mixins, set RESOURCE_VERSION (1 or 2), register in resource/__init__.py types dict.
Resource versioning: RESOURCE_VERSION = 1 or 2 determines /v1/ or /v2/ endpoint. SingletonAPIResource (User) has no plural or ID in URL.
Custom resource methods: Add instance methods for custom endpoints (def query(self, **params): return self._client.post(self._query_url(), params)).
Error handling: QuartzBioError in errors.py includes status_code, message (formatted from JSON), json_body, field_errors. Specific exceptions: NotFoundError, FileUploadError.
HTTP client: 5 retries with backoff_factor=2 for 502/503/504. Default timeout 80s. QUARTZBIO_RETRY_ALL env var retries all methods (default: only GET/HEAD).
Pagination transparency: all() and query iteration automatically fetch next pages. No manual pagination logic needed in client code.
Progress tracking: Task resources have follow(loop=True, sleep_seconds=5) method that polls status, prints progress, calls refresh() in loop.
Dict-based resources: All resources are dicts supporting both obj['field'] and obj.field access. Dict methods work: get(), items(), keys().
Logging: Dual output to stderr ([QuartzBio] format) and file (full format). Configure via QUARTZBIO_LOGLEVEL (default WARN), QUARTZBIO_LOGFILE (default ~/.quartzbio/quartzbio.log).
Python 3.8-3.13 support. Ensure compatibility across versions. Dependencies: requests>=2.0.0, urllib3>=1.26.0, pyprind. Optional: quartzbio[recipes] for pyyaml, click, ruamel.yaml.
CLI subcommands: login (auth), logout, whoami, shell (IPython with client), tutorial, import (with progress), create-dataset, upload. Entry point: quartzbio.cli.main:main.
Release process: 'bumpversion patch/minor/major', 'git push --tags', 'make changelog' (github_changelog_generator), 'make release' (twine to PyPI).
Prompting Guide: Reference .claude/docs/CLAUDE_PROMPTING_GUIDE.md for effective prompts for testing, debugging, resource development, and code review workflows.

Use Cases & Guardrails: Check .claude/docs/CLAUDE_USE_CASES.md for quick wins (test writing, documentation, bug fixes), common use cases, and important guardrails (never: PyPI releases without review, production tokens in tests, breaking API changes without deprecation).

Secret Management: Reference .claude/docs/CLAUDE_SECRET_INJECTION.md for credential management. Use ~/.quartzbio/credentials (netrc format) or environment variables. Never hardcode tokens, always read from environment or credentials file. Test credentials via QUARTZBIO_ACCESS_TOKEN.

Quick Wins for High Value: Test writing (~30-60min saved), code explanations (~20-40min), bug fixes (~15-30min), documentation (~15-30min), boilerplate generation (~20-45min). Start with these for immediate impact.

Know Your Limits: Require human review for: PyPI releases, breaking API changes, live API bulk operations, Python version compatibility, credential management code. Always test with tox across Python 3.8-3.13.

Documentation: Reference CLAUDE.md for architecture and mixin-based patterns. See .claude/docs/CLAUDE_PROMPTING_GUIDE.md for effective prompts, .claude/docs/CLAUDE_USE_CASES.md for workflows and guardrails, and .claude/docs/CLAUDE_SECRET_INJECTION.md for credential management. Keep all docs updated.
